page.title: 15Smarden Jumble Sales
page.content: Any Saturday afternoon in Smarden cars will be streaming into the village hall bringing buyers to a jumble sale. A queue usually forms as buyers rush to be first into the hall. Regulars know where the white elephant stall will be, and the first comers run looking for brass, china, old lamps cameras, watches & so on. Old radios, TVs, vacuum cleaners and carpets stand near the door. Important or valuable items may be housed on the stage where they will be safe. There are stalls for books & toys; clothes, outmoded or outgrown; shoes & bags. The produce stall has plants, fruit & vegetables and the home made cake stall always sells out fast. Jumble sales often make about Â£200, an easy way for a group to make money. Thieves too often have a good day, pocketing small items in the first rush of buyers.
